intro: Miconia yanachagaensis, commonly known as the Yanachaga miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the Amazon rainforest, specifically in the Peruvian region of Yanachaga. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white bracts that surround its small flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
